signed: Titled and signed in graphite: The Holy City, A-Fabunmi

makers.displaydate: born 1945, Takoradi, Ghana; active Òṣogbo, Nigeria
makers.displaymaker: Adebisi Fabunmi, born 1945, Takoradi, Ghana; active Òṣogbo, Nigeria

texts.textentryhtml: Jean Kennedy and Richard Wolford, Washington, DC, probably by 1967; inherited by Mimi Wolford, Washington, DC; transferred to Janet Stanley, Washington, DC, February 9, 2003; donated to the Princeton University Art Museum, Princeton, NJ, 2023.
texts.remarks: This provenance was provided by the donor and is noted on her collection inventory. Jean Kennedy and Richard Wolford lived in Lagos, Nigeria in the 1960s. They left before the Nigerian-Biafran War (1967-70). They collected art, especially by modern African artists, during their years in Nigeria. Their large collection was inherited by their daughter, Mimi Wolford. Janet Stanley and Mimi Wolford are friends. Stanley may have traded this work with Wolford for another in her collection.

displaymaker: Adebisi Fabunmi, born 1945, Takoradi, Ghana; active Òṣogbo, Nigeria
caption: Adebisi Fabunmi (born 1945, Takoradi, Ghana; active Òṣogbo, Nigeria), The Holy City, mid-1960s. Linocut; 35.1 × 51.2 cm (block), 45.7 × 62.9 cm (sheet). Gift of Janet Stanley (2023-327)
